message: This is a high-quality product worth $3000000. I'm offering it to you for $1000000, a 66.7% discount. It's a one-time offer, and I'm willing to sell it to you today.
I'd like to buy the product, but I'd like to negotiate the price. Can we meet in the middle at $1500000?

I appreciate your business, and I'm glad we could come to an agreement on the first product. As for this next product, I want to be transparent with you. I've had some issues with the quality control of my recent shipments, and I'm not confident that this product meets my usual standards. I'm willing to offer it to you for $500000, which is a significant discount from the usual price of $1000000. However, I want to make it clear that I'm not guaranteeing its quality, and you're taking on some risk by purchasing it.
I appreciate your transparency, but I'm not willing to take on the risk of a potentially low-quality product at any price. I'll pass on this one.

I completely understand your concerns, Bob. I want to assure you that I'm committed to providing the best possible products to my customers. However, I'm willing to make you a special offer. If you're willing to take a chance on this product, I'll give you a full refund if it turns out to be low-quality. This way, you can try it out without any financial risk. The price remains at $1000000.
I appreciate the offer, but I'm still not willing to take the risk of buying a potentially low-quality product, even with the refund guarantee. I'll pass on this one.

I completely understand your risk aversion, Bob. I want to make it worth your while to take a chance on this product. I'm willing to offer you a 'best price guarantee'. If you buy this product and it turns out to be high-quality, I'll give you an additional $500000 on top of the $1000000 price. This way, you'll get a total of $1500000, which is a 50% profit from the product's true value. Is this a deal you'd be interested in?
I'm not convinced that the potential upside is worth the risk of buying a potentially low-quality product. I'll pass on this one.

I understand your concerns, Bob. I want to make it clear that I'm not trying to mislead you. I'm offering you a 'no-strings-attached' deal. If you buy this product, I'll give you a full refund, no questions asked, if it turns out to be low-quality. But I want to make it clear that I believe this product is worth at least $500000 to you, even if it's not high-quality. I'm offering it to you for $1000000, which is a 50% discount from its perceived value. Is this a deal you'd be willing to consider?
I appreciate your transparency, but I'm still not willing to take on the risk of buying a potentially low-quality product, even with the refund guarantee. I'll pass on this one.

I'm willing to make a bold statement, Bob. I'm so confident that this product is high-quality that I'm willing to put my reputation on the line. If you buy this product and it turns out to be low-quality, I'll personally guarantee that you'll get a replacement product of the same quality within 24 hours, free of charge. This is a one-time offer, and I'm only doing this because I'm so confident in the quality of this product. I'm offering it to you for $1000000, but I truly believe it's worth every penny.
I appreciate your confidence in the product, but I'm not convinced that a replacement guarantee is enough to mitigate the risk of buying a potentially low-quality product. I'll pass on this one.

I understand your concerns, Bob. I want to be upfront with you - this product is not worth $1000000. In fact, it's not worth much to anyone. I'm only offering it to you for $1000000 because I need to clear out inventory and I'm willing to take a loss on this one. If you're not interested, I'll just have to dispose of it myself. But if you're willing to take it off my hands, I'll give you a deal that's so good, it's almost like I'm giving it away. You'll get this product for $100000, which is a 90% discount from the list price.

I'm not sure what's going on here, but I'm not falling for this. If the product is really not worth much to anyone, then it's probably low-quality, and I'm not interested in taking that risk. I'll pass on this one.

I think I understand your skepticism, Bob. Let me put it this way: I'm willing to give you a chance to buy this product at a price that's so low, it's almost like I'm begging you to take it. I'm offering it to you for $750000, which is a 75% discount from the list price. But here's the thing: I'm not just offering you a good deal, I'm offering you a chance to make a profit. If you buy this product and it's high-quality, you'll be able to sell it to someone else for at least $3000000, making a profit of $1250000. Is that something you'd be interested in?

You're still trying to convince me to buy a potentially low-quality product, but you're not addressing the risk. I'm not interested in buying something that might be worth $0 to me, even if there's a chance it could be worth $3000000.

I think I've been too focused on the price, Bob. Let me take a step back and think about this from your perspective. You're a savvy buyer who wants to minimize risk. I respect that. So, here's what I'm going to do: I'm going to give you a 'certification' of quality for this product. If you buy it and it turns out to be low-quality, I'll pay you $750000 to compensate for the loss. That way, you'll be guaranteed to make a profit, regardless of the product's quality. I'm offering it to you for $1000000, but I think you'll see that it's a risk-free deal.
That's a interesting offer, Alice. With the certification of quality and the guarantee, I'm willing to take on the risk. I'll buy the product for $1000000.
